title: Who decided these refund prices? Older players are just SOL?
body:
100 IP for a tier 3 rune and 400 for a Quint? Who exactly was in charge of this decision? I'm really glad I ***spent 7380 IP*** on Hybrid Pen marks to only get ***900*** back. Thanks for giving me 1200 IP for my Flat HP Quints ***that I spent 6150 IP on***. How very generous of you Riot.

"BUT OLDR PLAYRZ USED FOR LONGER HEHE"

Good to know that supporting your company for a long time means jack shit. Seems you want to cater to newer players because you already got our money right? Even though we put just as much effort into earning each and ever single one of those runes?

Is it worth it Riot? Is it worth pissing off all your old players? I'm actually dumbfounded by the fact that you even ***considered** this as an option.

Are your trying to one-up Valve's Artifact teaser or what? Did you need to make a new meme of yourself after Rengar's Q or something?

Considering the Runes used inside a game as an Item that you own and you should be able to use as you please is kinda ridiculous.

First, on a technical level, that's wrong. You don't own anything. If tomorrow Riot closes and shut down all the servers and you can't play LoL anymore, you won't be entitled to any access or back up of your Runes or anything like that.

Second, even if we're not pedantic about it, it's an in-game item in a video game, for fuck's sake! It's not canned food on your shelves. It's not even music on your hard-drives. If Riot was deleting your music from your hard-drive, you'd have a good reason to be angry, you wouldn't be able to listen to your music anymore. But your Runes? You can't use them for anything, that's not a good, that's not an item that you own. It's just a line of stat in a game. It's not "content", and presenting it that way is dishonest.

________________

> any makeshift justification of "well you had value out of them for years and you did things with them" is debunked instantly from the notion that we bought a permanent item at the time that we would be able to use them forever and ever and ever.

No, that's not true. Your "permanent" item was always limited to the lifespan of the game, at most. It was ALWAYS implicit that you wouldn't be able to use your Runes "forever and ever and ever". And this time, this is not me being pedantic again, it's an actually important point. Imagine an online game with no subscription, just an initial buying price, like Warcraft 3 or the like. When such a game closes their server because it's too old and no one is really playing anymore, they don't refund all the people who bought the game. Your "permanent" access to their servers was never really ACTUALLY permanent, and they have the right to take it from you whenever they want. And when Blizzard made Starcraft 2 free-to-play, they didn't refund all the people who bought the game before.

It's exactly the same here. Runes were a fee you had to pay to be able to compete on fair ground. Runes are not content. Buying Runes is not buying items, it's just buying the right to play the game (in good conditions). And you DID play the game for all those years since you bought Runes. Now Riot is making the game "free-to-play" (let's not forget we're not even talking about real money), and they have no obligation to refund the people who bought the Runes before, who paid the fee years ago.

Because Riot are not ass-holes, they are giving a partial refund, but this is purely out of good will. They had no obligation to do it. They are simply acknowledging that yes, you spent a lot of time and efforts, so they are giving something back, but they don't have to. And people flame them because they are not giving enough? Don't kid me.

This is the wrong argument to make.

You could argue that as a company Riot would screw themselves for the next few champion releases if they give players too much IP all at once. Thus it would be impossible from a business standpoint.

But saying that we got 'value' from them is poor reasoning. We didn't want runes, we had to buy them to stay competitive with other players who had the runes we didnt. We would much rather have spend the IP on champions if we had been given the choice.

I'm a bit late, but since your reply is actually a very good argument and there are so few of them in all this shit-storm, I really want to acknowledge that.

So yeah, phrasing it as "you got value out of it" was not the best idea. "Value" implies that you wanted Runes, when we were mostly forced to buy them. So let me re-phrase it.

You paid to access some system (Ranked on fair grounds, in that case) and you did get access to it. Now, this entry fee is removed and everyone can access it for free, but it doesn't change that you've been able to compete for years thanks to the fee you paid so long ago. So why should you get your fee back?

Look at Video games on Steam. You can buy it on day 1 and pay the full price. Or you can wait a couple years and buy it for 20 dollars less after a permanent price reduction. But game publishers won't refund all the people who bought the game full price on day 1 when that permanent price reduction happen.

Here, Riot is giving a partial "refund" purely out of good-will, it would have been entirely justifiable to give nothing at all, just as in the scenario I used above. And they get flamed for that good-will. It's absurd.

Thanks for your reply! Sorry I've been away and unable to respond.

I see what you mean, and I understand your argument. Honestly I can see reason behind both sides of the arguments surrounding runes refunds (in between all the shitstorm of course).

I think my issue isn't that they are or aren't doing it, It's more a matter of how they are doing it.

Player relations is a complicated issue, and implementing temporary 'rune store' for people to spend their refunded IP in is a smart idea, but with the way the refunds are given it seems a lot of players won't be able to afford any of the awesome crap available anyway.

So instead of providing a fair refund with an outlet to get rid of all that extra currency that would cost Riot badly to have around, they have provided many players with a stinging slap in the face.

With that circumstance I feel it would have been better to offer no refund at all, because the only result is still angry players despite having shelled out a bunch of refunds that the players cannot use anyway.

Maybe I'm wrong, but I get the feeling there will be too many players left with a crapton of IP after the store closes, and they will just feel bitter at having rewards dangled closely out of their reach.

Hopefully Riot has a plan for these players, because otherwise they will be left with a terrible PR situation despite their other efforts.

I can't exactly buy new champions and expect to use the same runes for every champion. So instead of buying new champions, I bought the runes needed to aid in fleshing out the strong points of the champion(s) I own. It would be better to go more armor runes on a rammus then having your standard attack damage runes. And since I was committed to top/jungle/support tanky champions, I literally didn't buy any ap runes for over a year until I was forced(*cough* autofill) into playing more in the mid lane. Not to mention the rune pages that I had to get to be able to switch to the specific runes that I needed. But now that the runes system is going away, I feel like I've wasted countless hours on runes rather than champions.
> 
> Sincerely, the many times where I could have had a specific champion to trade with another player.
> 
> And don't you dare say that I've made the most of my runes, because that is a weak argument

Honestly, I feel the same as him. When I first started all the people I knew emphasized the importance of runes on the game. Didn't really believe them that much at first, but I mained Warwick and  I was struggling early game so I custom tailored a rune page to him. Winrate sky-rocketed instantly, clear time decreased by a minute; and I realized what they meant. So instead of buying champions for the next two months I dumped all my ip into runes, afterwards I spent roughly 75% of my ip on runes for the next four months. I hated having so few champions to play, but I knew it would be a better long term investment to buy them up-front than to buy the champions, feeling like they were bad, only to buy runes later and find out that was why. 

If I had known when I was buying them all in late S6, that they would be replaced by the beginning of S8, I would have only bought tier 2 runes and made due with those. I wouldn't have invested so much in getting the best runes for my mains. The fact I made that investment thinking I would use them for probably four seasons before they would either revamp it with better runes to buy or I would retire from league.

Frankly the thing that annoys me the most is that they're giving us static ip back, it's not based on how much we spent, but how much we bought. For instance a Scaling AD Quint that was bought at 515 ip gives 300 ip, but so does a Life Steal Quint bought at 2050 ip. Not exactly fair. I do understand the reasoning to give less for the more someone has used it, so I'm not asking for a full refund(although I don't exactly think S7 people deserve a full refund either, especially those buying in august) but a 75% refund or even a 50% would be much better, otherwise I'm barely getting 20% back, while some people could be getting 60% back. Also although I see the reasoning with less ip the further back you bought them, it's also not fair to spit on those that have been with the game since the beginning. The difference should only be marginal: 75% for S6&S5 players, 70% for S4, 65% for S3, 60% for S2&S1 as an example.
